entrain()[source]

check if block is entrained and reset size if entrained :returns: excess – flag for if block/gravel is entrained or not :rtype: byte

get_Ustar()[source]

get river water shear velocity

Returns:

ustar – river water shear velocity

Return type:

float

get_ablation()[source]

Get river water shear velocity using the model of Costard et al. (2003). This model calculates hydraulic roughness based on bed gravel roughness.

Returns:

  • Va (float) – instantaneous ablation velocity, m/s

  • heatflux (float) – instantaneous heatflux, W/m2

get_ablation_bankgrainroughness()[source]

Get river water shear velocity using the model of Douglas and Lamb (2024). This model calculates hydraulic roughness based on bank sediment roughness.

Returns:

  • Va (float) – instantaneous ablation velocity, m/s

  • heatflux (float) – instantaneous heatflux, W/m2

get_erosion()[source]
Returns:

meanerosionrate_mperyear – mean annual erosion rate per year, averaged over the entire simulation

Return type:

float

load_bcs(bcdf)[source]

read river water conditions from data records

plot_bankprofile(title)[source]
Parameters:

title (str) – plot title

Returns:

fig – visual represntation of river bank vertical profile

Return type:

matplotlib figure

run()[source]

Run simulation from current profile to specified end time

solve_collapse()[source]

calculate erosion from upper bank collapse, based on Barnhart et al. (2003)

Returns:

  • C (array) – erosion for each node in the bank profile

  • Carea (float) – area of collapsed block

  • Ccount (int) – number of collapses in timestep

update_bcs()[source]

interpolate river water conditions from data records
